blocklist.displayName: Fighter (Arcane Archer) 7: Additional Arcane Shot Option

entries.name: Special
entries: If you miss an attack with the boomerang and there is enough space around for it to return to you, it returns to you at the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: When you hit a creature that is at most one size category larger than you with a harpoon, you can force it to succeed on a strength contest against you or be pulled up to 20 feet towards you.

entries.name: Special
entries: When you are attacked with a sword or sword-like weapon while you use the sword breaker, you gain a +1 bonus to your ac for that attack.

entries.name: Special
entries: While sheathed, this weapon looks like a normal walking cane.

entries.name: Special
entries: If you attack with a meteor hammer as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage on a hit and can't benefit from the weapons reach property.

entries.name: Special
entries: Once per turn, immediatly after you make an attack with the fan, or as a bonus action on your turn, you can fold or unfold the fan. When you do so, you gain a +1 to the next attack roll you make until the end of your next turn. In its folded state, the fan deals {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage instead of {@damage 1d6} slashing damage and has the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Special
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a bolas is knocked prone and can't stand up until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on creatures that are formless, don't need legs to move, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the bolas (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the bolas.

entries.name: Special
entries: As a bonus action, you can hide behind the shield to gain full cover until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Barrage
entries: You have learned to throw multiple projectiles with one swift motion.

As an action, you can throw daggers or darts in a 20-foot cone. When you do so, a number of creature of your choice within that area equal to the number of weapons you throw must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier) or take the thrown weapons damage. If a creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it takes an extra {@damage 1d8} damage of the weapon's type.
The extra damage increases by {@damage 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

feat.name: Dash Attack
entries: You have learned to use the momentum of your movement for your attacks.
Immediatly after you take the dash action, you can make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action.
In addition, if you move at least 10 feet straight towards a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d10} damage of the weapon's type.
The extra damage increases by {@damage 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d10}), 11th level ({@damage 3d10}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d10}).

feat.name: Shield Bash

prerequisite.other: Proficiency with any kind of shield

entries: You have learned to use your shield in more offensive ways.

When a creature misses you with a melee attack while you are wielding a shield, you can use your reaction and bash the creature with your shield. It takes {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and the next attack roll against the creature is made with advantage.
If you are wielding a spiked shield, you deal the damage of the shield instead of the bludgeoning damage.

feat.name: Spin Attack
entries: You have learned to use the weight of your weapon for your advantage.

As an action, while wielding a greatsword or greataxe, you can perform a spin attack. When you do so, make a melee weapon attack against each creature within 5 feet of you. A creature hit by your attack has to succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition prone} by the attack. If a creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the weapon's type.
The extra damage increases by {@damage 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

item.name: +1 Arcane Bracers
entries: This bracers are made of pure silver engraved with elvish runes glowing in a faint blue. While wearing these bracers you gain a +1 bonus to the damage and DC of your arcane shots.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to regain two uses of your Arcane Shot feature. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: +1 Battle Standard of Power
entries: While you hold this banner, you and all allied creatures within 60 feet of you gain a +1 bonus to weapon attack and damage rolls.

item.name: +1 Gauntlets of Superiority
entries: This pair of masterfully crafted gauntlets is made of high quality steel. While wearing this magic item, you gain a +1 bonus to the damage and DC of your maneuvers.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to regain 2 superiority dice. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: +2 Arcane Bracers
entries: This bracers are made of pure silver engraved with elvish runes glowing in a faint blue. While wearing these bracers you gain a +2 bonus to the damage and DC of your arcane shots.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to regain two uses of your Arcane Shot feature. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: +2 Battle Standard of Power
entries: While you hold this banner, you and all allied creatures within 60 feet of you gain a +2 bonus to weapon attack and damage rolls.

item.name: +2 Gauntlets of Superiority
entries: This pair of masterfully crafted gauntlets is made of high quality steel. While wearing this magic item, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage and DC of your maneuvers.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to regain 2 superiority dice. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: +3 Arcane Bracers
entries: This bracers are made of pure silver engraved with elvish runes glowing in a faint blue. While wearing these bracers you gain a +3 bonus to the damage and DC of your arcane shots.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to regain two uses of your Arcane Shot feature. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: +3 Battle Standard of Power
entries: While you hold this banner, you and all allied creatures within 60 feet of you gain a +3 bonus to weapon attack and damage rolls.

item.name: +3 Gauntlets of Superiority
entries: This pair of masterfully crafted gauntlets is made of high quality steel. While wearing this magic item, you gain a +3 bonus to the damage and DC of your maneuvers.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to regain 2 superiority dice. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Amulet of Warning
entries: While wearing this amulet, you can't be suprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The amulet magically awakens you if you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

item.name: Battle Standard of the Commander
entries: While you hold this banner, you can use a bonus action and choose one creature within 60 feet of you. That creature can make one melee or ranged weapon attack with its reaction, provided that it can see or hear you. After you use this item, roll a d6. If you roll a 4 or lower, you can't use the item again for 1 hour.

item.name: Battle Standard of Courage
entries: While you hold the banner, you and all allied creatures within 300 feet of you are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition.

entries.name: Armor Piercing
entries: When you attack a creature wearing medium or heavy armor, you gain a bonus to your attack roll equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down).

entries.name: Lunge
entries: Once per turn, when you make a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can increase your reach for that attack by 5 feet.

entries.name: Sweep
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can attempt to damage another creature with the same attack. Choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach. If the original attack roll would hit the second creature, it takes damage equal to your Proficiency bonus. The damage is of the same type dealt by the original attack.

entries.name: Feint
entries: You can use a bonus action on your turn to feint, choosing one creature within 5 feet of you as your target. You have advantage on your next attack roll this turn against that creature.

entries.name: Trip
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can attempt to knock the target down. If the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you knock the target prone.

entries.name: Push
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can attempt to drive the target back. If the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you push the target up to 10 feet away from you.

entries.name: Riposte
entries: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the creature.

entries.name: Brace
entries: When a creature you can see moves into the reach you have with this weapon, you can use your reaction to make one attack against the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Berserker
entries: For some barbarians, rage is a means to an end—that end being violence. The Path of the Berserker is a path of untrammeled fury, slick with blood. As you enter the berserker's rage, you thrill in the chaos of battle, heedless of your own health or well-being.

subclassFeature.name: Intimidating Presence
entries: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, you strike fear in the hearts of your opponents. While raging, any creature of your choice within 30 feet of you that can see you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or be {@condition frightend} of you until your rage ends. A frightend creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.
If a creature succeeds on its saving throw, it is immune to this feature for the next 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Frenzy
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can enter a frenzy when you rage. When you do so, your melee weapon attacks deal extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus for the duration of your rage.

In addition, your bloodlust startles your opponents. As a bonus action, you can choose a creature frightend of you within 30 feet of you. The creature must succeed on another Wisdom saving throw, or its speed is reduced to 0 and it can't cast spells or concentrate on them until the end of your next turn. On subsequent turns, you can use your bonus action to extend the duration of this effect on the creature until the end of your next turn.
When your rage ends, you suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Archer
entries: An Arcane Archer studies a unique elven method of archery that weaves magic into attacks to produce supernatural effects. Arcane Archers are some of the most elite warriors among the elves. They stand watch over the fringes of elven domains, keeping a keen eye out for trespassers and using magic-infused arrows to defeat monsters and invaders before they can reach elven settlements. Over the centuries, the methods of these elf archers have been learned by members of other races who can also balance arcane aptitude with archery.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to unleash special magical effects with some of your shots. When you gain this feature, you learn two Arcane Shot options of your choice (see "Arcane Shot Options" below).

Once per turn, when you fire an arrow from a shortbow or longbow as part of the Attack action, you can apply one of your Arcane Shot options to that arrow. You decide to use the option when the arrow hits a creature, unless the option doesn't involve an attack roll. You can use this ability a number of time equal to your Intelligence modifier and you regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.
You gain an additional Arcane Shot option of your choice when you reach certain levels in this class: 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level. Each option also improves when you become an 18th-level fighter.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot Options
entries: The Arcane Shot feature lets you choose options for it at certain levels. The options are presented here in alphabetical order. They are all magical effects, and each one is associated with one of the schools of magic.
If an option requires a saving throw, your Arcane Shot save DC is calculated as follows:

subclassFeature.name: Volatile Shot
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can imbue your arrows with a large amount of magic. When you fire an arrow from a shortbow or longbow as part of the Attack action, you can shot an arrow infused with volatile magic.

When you do so, choose a point that you can see within 90 feet of you. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Arcane Shot save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 8d6} force damage or half as much damage on a successful one.
Once you used this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Curving Shot
entries: At 15th level, you learn how to direct an errant arrow toward a new target. When you make an attack roll with a magic arrow and miss, you can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.

subclassFeature.name: Disintegrating Shot
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can imbue your arrows with disintegration magic. As an action, you can shot an arrow in a 100 feet long 5 feet wide line. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Arcane Shot save DC or take {@damage 5d6 + 20} force damage. A creature is disintegrated if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points.
Once you used this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
